titleStmt.title: To JAMES SHERIDAN MUSPRATT,James Sheridan Muspratt (1821-71; Dictionary of National Biography), industrial chemist. On 8 July he had been elected Secretary of the Liverpool committee organising the benefit performances on 28 July, for CD's friend Leigh Hunt (1784-1859; Dictionary of National Biography), the poet, essayist and editor of literary journals, who perennially fell into financial difficulties. 22 JULY [1847]

body.p: Will you have the goodness, by return of post, to send a proof of the last complete bill,The 4-page broadsheet, giving details of the performances, is reproduced in Pilgrim Letters 5, pp. 694-7 addressed "Mark LemonMark Lemon (1809-1870; Dictionary of National Biography), playwright and editor of Punch 1841-70. Esquire, Punch office, Fleet Street, London"? We wish to print it with the address.The address was written by Edward Bulwer Lytton (1803-73; Dictionary of National Biography), and delivered by John Forster (1812-76; Dictionary of National Biography)
